statements: INSERT INTO fashion_products (id, product_name, price, color, size) VALUES (1, 'T-shirt', 20.99, 'Black', 'M') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name='T-shirt', price=20.99, color='Black', size='M';
INSERT INTO fashion_products (id, product_name, price, color, size) VALUES (2, 'Jeans', 39.99, 'Blue', 'L') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name='Jeans', price=39.99, color='Blue', size='L';
INSERT INTO fashion_products (id, product_name, price, color, size) VALUES (3, 'Dress', 49.99, 'Red', 'S') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name='Dress', price=49.99, color='Red', size='S';
UPSERT INTO clothing (id, name, price) VALUES (1, 'T-Shirt', 19.99);
UPSERT INTO brands (id, name, established_year) VALUES (1, 'Nike', 1964);
UPSERT INTO clothing (id, name, price) VALUES (2, 'Jeans', 49.99);
INSERT INTO Brand (brand_id, brand_name, headquarters_location) VALUES (1, 'Nike', 'Oregon') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE brand_name='Nike', headquarters_location='Oregon';
INSERT INTO Product (product_id, product_name, brand_id) VALUES (1, 'Shoes', 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name='Shoes', brand_id=1;

INSERT INTO Customer (customer_id, customer_name, gender, age, purchase_history) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 'Male', 30, 'Shoes, Clothes') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE customer_name='John Doe', gender='Male', age=30, purchase_history='Shoes, Clothes';
INSERT INTO Brand (brand_id, brand_name) VALUES (1, 'Nike') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE brand_name = 'Nike';
INSERT INTO Category (category_id, category_name) VALUES (1, 'Shoes') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE category_name = 'Shoes';
INSERT INTO Product (product_id, product_name, brand_id, category_id) VALUES (1, 'Air Max', 1, 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name = 'Air Max', brand_id = 1, category_id = 1;
UPSERT INTO Brand (brand_id, brand_name) VALUES (1, 'Example Brand 1') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE brand_name = 'Example Brand 1';

UPSERT INTO Category (category_id, category_name, category_description) VALUES (1, 'Example Category 1', 'This is an example category') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE category_name = 'Example Category 1', category_description = 'This is an example category';
UPSERT INTO Product (product_id, product_name, brand_id, category_id) VALUES (1, 'Example Product 1', 1, 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE product_name = 'Example Product 1';
